Job Title: Senior Financial Analyst

Location: Charleston, SC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
Job Description Summary

The Senior Financial Analyst serves as a strategic financial resource for the Director of Financial Integrity & Analysis.

This position is an expert in evaluating and resolving complex financial issues and demonstrates strong analytical and financial skills to maximize financial operations.

Entity

Medical University Hospital Authority (MUHA)

Worker Type

Employee

Worker Sub-Type 

Regular

Cost Center

CC001097 SYS - Corp Health System Finance

Pay Rate Type

Salary

Pay Grade

Health-29

Scheduled Weekly Hours

40

Work Shift

Job Description

The Senior Financial Analyst reports to the Director of Financial Planning and Analysis under MUSC Health Corporate System Finance. Under limited supervision, the Senior Financial Analyst provides credible/reliable, consistent, standardized, and integrated financial consultative services for Markets and Integrated Centers of Clinical Excellent (ICCE) and/or Functional Areas.

Prepares and compiles all financial requests including preforms, return on investment calculations, financial modeling and financial data requests in conjunction with System Finance teams.

Serves as the subject matter expert in financial operations supporting decision making, financial strategy, performance improvement, and other key financial goals through valid, relevant, and quality decision support reports, dashboards, and analyses.

Takes a lead role in financial analysis; participates in team and project meetings; and provides input on intelligent solutions to improve efficiency and financial position of the Markets and ICCE and/or Functional Areas.

Additional Job Description

Master’s degree and three (3) years of experience in a position of significant financial and operational responsibility and data analysis required.

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Health Administration, Accounting or related field with five (5) years directly related experience.

Proven ability to research, gather, synthesize and organize information to produce concise reports using various resources.

Must be proficient in the use of spreadsheets and have excellent oral and written communication skills to communicate complicated policies and procedures and financial information to a wide variety of audiences.

Must be able to demonstrate expert skills in identifying key stakeholders, acquiring and preparing financial data, selecting and applying analytic tools, and producing actionable results.

Academic Medical Center (AMC) Healthcare experience preferred.

Solid understanding of data mining techniques, emerging techniques and a proactive approach.

Ability to coordinate and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.

Ability to work independently and carry out assignments to completion based on the original goals with minimal supervision.

If you like working with energetic enthusiastic individuals, you will enjoy your career with us!

The Medical University of South Carolina is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MUSC does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion or belief, age, sex, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, protected veteran status, family or parental status, or any other status protected by state laws and/or federal regulations.
